title: Kenai Fjords National Park: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery               Photo Gallery                    NPS Centennial Events   2 Photos  Events celebrating the National Park Service Centennial in 2016.           Glaciers of Kenai Fjords   48 Photos  There are at least 38 glaciers which flow from the Harding Icefield. 12 of these glaciers terminate within park boundaries.           Kenai Fjords Coast   8 Photos  The coast of Kenai Fjords National Park stretches for 545 stern and rocky miles.            Harding Icefield   16 Photos  Stretching for 700 square miles, the ice field is the central feature of Kenai Fjords National Park.           Exit Glacier Area   14 Photos  Exit Glacier is the primary destination for visitors to witness up close the power of the glaciers. It is also the home to the Exit Glacier Nature Center and the trail head for the Harding Icefield Trail.          Plants   13 Photos  Photos of the rich flora of Kenai Fjords.            Wildlife   7 Photos  Kenai Fjords is home to wildlife of all shapes and sizes, from the mammoth humpback whale, to the hoary marmot in its high meadows.          Bald Eagles   7 Photos  Bald eagles are one of most commonly seen inhabitants of Kenai Fjords.           Black Oystercatcher   8 Photos  Living its life between the crash of the waves, this iconic shorebird spends its days feeding in the rich intertidal zone.             Tufted and Horned Puffins   3 Photos  Kenai Fjords National Park is home to both tufted and horned puffins.           Sea Otters   36 Photos  Described as "soft gold" by the Russian fur-trappers, these marine mammals are an iconic part of the Alaskan landscape.               Prev    1   2   of 2  Next
